alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 17 at 6:55PM MDT until June 17 at 9:15PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east central Colorado, including the following county, Kit Carson. * WHEN...Until 600 AM MDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 650 PM MDT, flooding associated with heavy rainfall yesterday evening continues across the warned area. 1 to 2 inches of additional rainfall observed this afternoon will further exacerbate ongoing flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Flagler and Seibert. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
